data.title: Billy Joel’s famous exes, staggering 33-year age gap with wife inspired songs
data.meta_description: Billy Joel has had some pretty famous ex-wives and girlfriends, including one who was 33 years young than him, and some of them inspired him.
data.text:
Billy Joel hopes that this marriage is FOURTH time lucky

Billy Joel is one of the best-selling music artists of all time, with over 150 million records sold worldwide and six Grammy Awards to his name.

Throughout his impressive decades-long career, the Piano Man has performed on the Grammys' stage a couple of times.

However, the singer-songwriter is scheduled to perform during music's most important night for the first time in more than 20 years on Feb. 4.

Ahead of his performance, it's worth revisiting his impressive career spanning over four decades, but also his high-profile relationships.

Joel has been married to some famous women, and some of them have inspired him to write some of his hit songs, but here's a deeper look into his dating and relationship history.

Read more: Billy Joel tickets: Last chance to get tickets to Billy Joel's only UK show today

Joel's first wife was Elizabeth Weber.

His songs Just the Way You Are, She’s Got a Way and She’s Always a Woman are thought to be inspired by her.

The pair met in 1970 through the artist's friend and bandmate Jon Small, who was married to Weber at the time.

After they started an affair, Small found out and Weber ended up leaving them both.

Joel and Weber later got back together and married in 1973.

Years later the pair had a nasty divorce in 1982, with Weber’s brother accused of stealing millions from Joel.

The Piano Man's next wife was model Christie Brinkley, who is said to have inspired This Is the Time and the entire album An Innocent Man.

DON'T MISS:

'Piano Man's back in the groove': Billy Joel The Vinyl Collection Vol 2 review - [REPORT]

Billy Joel BST Hyde Park review: The Piano Man is still the great Entertainer - [INSIGHT]

The Piano Man put New York fans in a Billy Joel state of mind - [LATEST]

After divorcing Weber, the singer went to St. Bart's where he started playing at a piano bar and met supermodels Elle MacPherson, Christie Brinkley and singer Whitney Houston.

Joel, who was 33 at the time, returned home to find MacPherson, 19, and Brinkley, 28, were both after his affections.

He briefly dated MacPherson, but it was Brinkley who he later married in 1985.

They welcomed daughter, Alexa Ray Joel, the same year, but the pair split nine years later, divorcing in 1994.

While Brinkley famously appeared in the music video for his hit Uptown Girl, the song was actually about her, MacPherson, and other models.

According to reports (per Smooth Radio), the song was originally called Uptown Girls.

After taking a break from marriage and relationships, Joel began a relationship with culinary professional and Food Network star Katie Lee.

At the time, Billy was 55 and Katie was 23, and the pair married in 2004.

Their marriage ended five years later in 2009.

The couple released a statement claiming they were "caring friends" and a spokesperson denied a third party was involved in the break-down of their relationship (per the Daily Mail).

Sources at the time said the 33-year gap finally took its toll. "It was really the age difference that caught up with them," a friend of the couple told New York's Daily News.

"They grew apart. She is very career-oriented. She loves going out. She loves the city. When Billy isn't touring, he'd rather be on Long Island with his motorcycles and boats."

Joel is currently married to 39-year-old Alexis Roderick, is a former executive at Morgan Stanley who now works as an equestrian.

The pair met in 2009 and tied the knot in 2015.

The couple have two daughters together; Della Rose Joel and Remy Anne Joel.

He seems to be content in his fourth marriage as he continues to perform around the world, celebrating his music.
